column4: I have created a startup script that should run in terminal.. how can i see the output?
depends, do you want the output in a file?
no i just want to see it live : )
or you could have the script started in a gnome-terminal
this is what i have.. but its not doing anything :p gnome-terminal -e "bash --rcfile /home/user/miner1.sh"
however, it will quit when the script quits
maybe it is starting and then quiting?
Just did gnome-terminal -c "path/to/script"    with " < right? didnt work here :p
i can run the script fine by doing ./blabla.sh
Do i need the path if its in my home folder?
